entry.def: When you readjust to a new situation, usually one you have been in before, you adapt to it.

example.ex: I can understand why astronauts find it difficult to readjust to life on earth...
example.tran: 我能够理解为什么宇航员发现重新适应地球上的生活不容易。

example.ex: They are bound to take time to readjust after a holiday.
example.tran: 他们肯定需要时间重新适应假期结束后的生活。

entry.def: If you readjust the level of something, your attitude to something, or the way you do something, you change it to make it more effective or appropriate.

example.ex: The rebel army has readjusted its strategy...
example.tran: 叛军已经重新调整了策略。

example.ex: In the end you have to readjust your expectations...
example.tran: 最后，你需要调整你的预期。

entry.def: If you readjust something such as a piece of clothing or a mechanical device, you correct or alter its position or setting.

example.ex: Michael groaned and readjusted his shorts...
example.tran: 迈克尔一边发着牢骚一边整了整自己的短裤。

example.ex: Readjust your watch. You are now on Moscow time.
example.tran: 重新调一下你的手表。现在是莫斯科时间。

sentences.sentence: "After moving back to America, he had to readjust"
